alert.note: Alert for Coconino (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued September 10 at 1:12PM MST until September 10 at 3:00PM MST by NWS Flagstaff
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 3 PM MST/4 PM MDT/ THIS AFTERNOON FOR THE PIPELINE BURN SCAR AND PORTIONS OF U.S. HIGHWAY 89 IN COCONINO COUNTY... At 106 PM MST /206 PM MDT/, the public reported ongoing flash flooding on portions of Highway 89 just north of Wupatki Trails, produced by heavy rain from thunderstorms across the warned area. The north and south bounds of Highway 89 just north of Wupatki Trails have been closed due to water over the roadway. Between 0.5 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. Even though the heavier rainfall has ended, flash flooding is expected to continue as water drains. HAZARD...Life-threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Public reported. IMPACT...Life-threatening flash flooding of low-water crossings, creeks, normally dry washes and roads. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Flagstaff, Bonito Campground At Sunset Crater, Wupatki Trails, Sunset Crater Volcano National Monument, Fernwood, Timberline, Hutchison Acres, Doney Park, Sunset Crater Visitors Center, Lockett Meadow Campground and Little Elden Spring Horse Camp. This includes the following highways... U.S. Highway 89 between mile markers 423 and 439. This includes the following creeks, washes and rivers... Deadman Wash, San Francisco Wash, Hulls Wash, Ball Court Wash, Schultz Creek and Kanaa Wash. FLASH FLOOD...OBSERVED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Flooding of washes and creeks will occur, some dirt roads will become muddy and impassable. Paved roads and underpasses could become flooded as well. Flash flooding is occurring or imminent downstream of the Pipeline Fire scar, including Wupatki Trails, Fernwood, Hutchinson Acres, Macann Estates and Doney Park. Ash and debris-filled waters will impact roads, including Highway 89. Shelter in place until the waters recede. Stay out of flood waters!
